title: Is a Japanese sweet potato a nightshade? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you mean Satsuma-Imo, the most common “sweet potatoes” in Japan, then no, they belong to morning glories:  Here’s Wikipedia explaining this very well: Sweet potato - Wikipedia Also, please note that there are many kinds of potatoes in Japan. The so-called Japanese yams (yamaimo) are different again and they belong to genus dioscorea:  There are also taro, in Japan called satoimo, which belong to Colocasia:  All different, as you see and only jagaimo belong to nightshades.
